de.bioforscher.singa.chemistry.physical.leaves

Class LeafSubstructure<LeafSubstructureType extends LeafSubstructure<LeafSubstructureType,FamilyType>,FamilyType extends StructuralFamily>

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.bioforscher.singa.chemistry.physical.leaves.LeafSubstructure<LeafSubstructureType,FamilyType>
  • Type Parameters:
    LeafSubstructureType - A self reference to remember valid neighbours.
    FamilyType - The possible representations of this leaf substructure implementation.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Exchangeable<FamilyType>, StructuralEntity<LeafSubstructureType,LeafIdentifier>, Substructure<LeafSubstructureType,LeafIdentifier>, Nameable, Graph<Atom,Bond,java.lang.Integer>, Node<LeafSubstructureType,Vector3D,LeafIdentifier>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AminoAcid, AtomContainer, Nucleotide

    public abstract class LeafSubstructure<LeafSubstructureType extends LeafSubstructure<LeafSubstructureType,FamilyType>,FamilyType extends StructuralFamily>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Substructure<LeafSubstructureType,LeafIdentifier>, Exchangeable<FamilyType>, Nameable
    The leaf substructure class represents a atom containing grouping entry in the three dimensional physical representation any macro molecular structure. This abstract class is used to handle the atoms contained in this structure and the bonds connecting them in a graph-like fashion. Implementations comprise AminoAcid, AtomContainer,

    • Constructor Detail

      • LeafSubstructure

        public LeafSubstructure(LeafIdentifier leafIdentifier,
                        FamilyType family)

      • LeafSubstructure

        public LeafSubstructure(LeafSubstructure<LeafSubstructureType,FamilyType> leafSubstructure)
        This is a copy constructor. Creates a new leaf with the same attributes as the given leaf. This also recursively creates copies of all the underlying substructures and atoms. The neighbours of this substructure are NOT copied. Due to the nature of this operation it would be bad to keep a part of the relations to the lifecycle of the substructure to copy. If you want to keep the neighbouring substructures, copy the superordinate substructure that contains this substructure and it will also traverse and copy the neighbouring substructures.
        Parameters:
        leafSubstructure - The leaf to copy.

      • nextEdgeIdentifier

        public int nextEdgeIdentifier()
        Returns the next free edge identifer. This method returns the value of a counting variable that is used to add all internal edges. Every time this method is called a new identifer is given. You should only need to use this method if you really need to add a bond form outside.
        Specified by:
        nextEdgeIdentifier in interface Graph<Atom,Bond,java.lang.Integer>
        Returns:
        The next free bond identifer.

      • addEdgeBetween

        public int addEdgeBetween(Bond edge,
                          Atom source,
                          Atom target)
        Adds a bond connecting the the given atoms. The order of the given atoms does not matter, but is retained. The bond type can be specified beforehand and the pdbIdentifier of the edge is used as the identifer in the leaf.

      • getPosition

        public Vector3D getPosition()
        Returns the centroid of ALL atoms of the LeafSubstructure. This may be not intended, because hydrogens are considered as well. You can use an implementation of RepresentationScheme that does not consider hydrogens at all.
        Specified by:
